At meeting ofCommissioned Officers attached 10
the first Brigade of Delaware Militia, held at the
house of Thomas Alulord, in ST. Georges, on Satur.
day the 9th of October, 1927, Brigadier General
RICHARD MANSFIELD was called to the chalr-and
Captain JOHN SUTTON appointed Secretary.


The meeting aware OF their object in assembling
and conscious of its being the wish of all Commls-
stoned Officers Of the Brigade, (and particularly OF
those of the Volunteer Corps, that they shall not
only become an organized body, but one noted for
their military department. good discipline and tac-
tics feel no hesitation, in order to forward this
grand object in adopting the following resolutions,
and requesting the particular attention of the brl-
gade TO them, viz.


Resolved, That the volunteer Companies ofCava'-
ry, Artillery, Rhemen and Light Infantry, together
with the District Companies, attached to the First
Brigade fDelascare Militia, be, and are hereby res,
pcctiully invited to meet at RED LION OLD
FIELDS, on Friday the 26M October Inst, at 10 o
clock A. M. fully equipped, to be exercised in Bat
talon.


Resolved, That the Commanding Officers of Com
panies be requested to give timely notice to their
respective Companies, of the proceedings Of this
meeting, and request their punctual attendance at
the time and place ofmeeting


RICHARD MANSFIELD, Chairmda.
JOHN SUTTON, Sec'y.

THE Subscriber offers for private sale, valua-
BILE Farm, lying on the turnpike, leading to Elk,
about two miles below Chistiana-Brdge. 1t con-
tains IL acres, so of which under thriving tim
Der, and the remainder under tillage, with good
proportion well set with covcr there is also on the
premises good bearing orchard--the fences are in
good order. The buildings are IA good dwelling
house, stable and granary. further description
will be given, and the land shewn to any one apply
ing, by the subscriber, living on the Plantation.


WILLIAM Is. M'INTlRE.

and giving concise history of the mostimportant
events in Europe, as well as detailed account of
the sanguinary battles in which he engaged in or
connected with, down to the time of his death, in
l82l--in three closely printed vo vols. more
valuable record, has perhaps seldom been offered to
the Public and the facts are rendered still more IN
tcrestng by the popular talent of the noble writer.

Sep 28, 1897. 46-4t
Notice.

THIS Institution will be opened on Monday


the 25th of October Inst, under the care


ofthe Rev. JosErH WILSON


In this Seminary students will be thoroughly in
structed in the different branches of agood English
and Classical Education, viz Reading Writing,
Arithmetic, English Grammar, Geography, Compo-
sit,on. Elocution, Mathematics and the Greek and
Latin Languages The terms of tuition will be for
the English branches, exclusive of Mathematics,
Ss per session, or $40, including the Mathematics;
for the Languages, including the English, $40 per
session. Tuition money to be paid in advance.
There will be two sessions iii the year, with a
short vacation between each.


Good boarding can be obtained in respectable
families in the village at the rate of Forty Dollars
per session and few boarders can be accommo-
dated in the family OF the Principal.


JOHN EDDOWES. Sec'y

bills forwarded to the Secretary.

and conscious of its being the wish of all Commls-

Resolved, That the volunteer Companies ofCava'-

The Bonds and Notes given for property purchas.
ed at the Sales Of DAVID HlGoINs, deeds per-

pect any indulgence. Payment may be made to eth
er Of the subscribers.

full articles.headline:
.MidlllctO,um .AcNltcnsy.


CLASSICAL z3EPxARTlMETsl. q.

THIS Institution will be opened on Monday
the 25th of October Inst, under the care


of the Rev. JosEpn WILSON.
full articles.article:
THIS Institution will be opened on Monday


the 25th of October Inst, under the care


ofthe Rev. JosErH WILSON


In this Seminary students will be thoroughly in
structed in the different branches of agood English
and Classical Education, viz Reading Writing,
Arithmetic, English Grammar, Geography, Compo-
sit,on. Elocution, Mathematics and the Greek and
Latin Languages The terms of tuition will be for
the English branches, exclusive of Mathematics,
Ss per session, or $40, including the Mathematics;
for the Languages, including the English, $40 per
session. Tuition money to be paid in advance.
There will be two sessions iii the year, with a
short vacation between each.


Good boarding can be obtained in respectable
families in the village at the rate of Forty Dollars
per session and few boarders can be accommo-
dated in the family OF the Principal.


JOHN EDDOWES. Sec'y
.Middlefonn, October |, 1927. 48--3m
0Ny-To be published in the Ekton Press, ,-Ches-
tertown elegraph--Centreville Times-and in the
Easton (Md) papers for three months, and their
bills forwarded to the Secretary.
